title: Blast at Rally for Afghan President Ashraf Ghani Kills at Least 24
text:
A bomb blast at a campaign rally for President Ashraf Ghani in northern Afghanistan on Tuesday narrowly missed the president, killing at least 24 people and wounding at least 31, officials said.

Mr. Ghani, who officials said was not hurt, had mostly been campaigning ahead of the Sept. 28 presidential vote by video conference, but had decided to make the trip north to Parwan Province for the rally. One official said the president was inside a building when the bomb exploded on a motorcycle just outside. Many of the dead were civilians, hospital officials said.

The campaign season so far has labored under threat from Taliban insurgents, and from the uncertainty surrounding the collapse of negotiations between Taliban and American officials on the eve of an agreement on a troop withdrawal schedule.

In July, Mr. Ghani’s first vice president, Amrullah Saleh, narrowly escaped a complex attack featuring a car bomb and a half-dozen suicide bombers on his political headquarters in Kabul.
description: The blast narrowly missed Mr. Ghani, officials said. The bombing in northern Afghanistan comes in an election season that has labored under threats of violence by the Taliban.
